alert.note: Alert for Harney County; Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:55PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Harney and southwestern Malheur Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 454 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Red Mountain, or 22 miles northeast of Denio, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Harney and southwestern Malheur Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
